main event: Multiple objects were observed descending over Marion, Indiana, in September 1960, exhibiting flare-like appearances before burning out.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 3 minutes,The objects were described as having a burning copper color and were possibly of Russian origin,The objects were speculated to be performing electronic surveillance,Descriptions suggest the objects were receiving low-level radiation prior to burning out,The conclusions included possibilities of balloon, aircraft, or meteor.
witness description: Information from a Project 10073 Record Card, possible civilian sources.
